rotation.title: Rotation
rotation.description: 3D object rotation in degrees by default; Right-handed coordinate system. Switches to quaternion representation if 'w' is given

material.title: Material
material.description: The material properties of the object’s surface.

src.description: URI, relative or full path of an image/video file. e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/360falls.mp4'

transparent.description: Whether material is transparent. Transparent entities are rendered after non-transparent entities.

opacity.description: Extent of transparency. If the transparent property is not true, then the material will remain opaque and opacity will only affect color.

render-order.description: The render-order system takes a comma-delimited list of strings that name the render order layers. The render order layers will map to a number starting from 0 and counting up from there.

side.description: Which sides of the mesh to render. Can be one of front, back, or double.

depthTest.description: Whether depth testing is enabled when rendering the material.

shader.description: Which material to use. Defaults to the standard material. Can be set to the flat material or to a registered custom shader material.

vertexColors.description: Whether to use vertex or face colors to shade the material. Can be one of none, vertex, or face.

visible.description: Whether material is visible. Raycasters will ignore invisible materials.

blending.description: The blending mode for the material’s RGB and Alpha sent to the WebGLRenderer. Can be one of none, normal, additive, subtractive or multiply

dithering.description: Whether material is dithered with noise. Removes banding from gradients like ones produced by lighting.

multisrc.title: Multi Source
multisrc.description: Define multiple visual sources applied to an object.

srcspath.description: URI, relative or full path of a directory containing srcs, e.g. “store/users/wiselab/images/dice/” (required).

srcs.description: A comma-delimited list if URIs, e.g. “side1.png, side2.png, side3.png, side4.png, side5.png, side6.png” (required).

property.description: Property to animate. Can be a component name, a dot-delimited property of a component (e.g., material.color), or a plain attribute.

isRawProperty.description: Flag to animate an arbitrary object property outside of A-Frame components for better performance. If set to true, for example, we can set property to like components.material.material.opacity. If property starts with components or object3D, this will be inferred to true.

from.description: Initial value at start of animation. If not specified, the current property value of the entity will be used (will be sampled on each animation start). It is best to specify a from value when possible for stability.

to.description: Target value at end of animation.

type.description: Right now only supports color for tweening isRawProperty color XYZ/RGB vector values.

delay.description: How long (milliseconds) to wait before starting.

dir.description: Which dir to go from from to to.

dur.description: How long (milliseconds) each cycle of the animation is.

loop.description: How many times the animation should repeat. If the value is true, the animation will repeat infinitely.

animation-mixer.title: Animation Mixer
animation-mixer.description: A list of available animations can usually be found by inspecting the model file or its documentation. All animations will play by default. To play only a specific set of animations, use wildcards: animation-mixer='clip: run_*'

clip.description: Name of the animation clip(s) to play. Accepts wildcards.

duration.description: Duration of the animation, in seconds (0 = auto).

crossFadeDuration.description: Duration of cross-fades between clips, in seconds.

repetitions.description: Number of times to play the clip, in addition to the first play. Repetitions are ignored for loop: once.

timeScale.description: Scaling factor for playback speed. A value of 0 causes the animation to pause. Negative values cause the animation to play backwards.

clampWhenFinished.description: If true, halts the animation at the last frame.

sound.title: Positional Sound
sound.description: The sound component defines the entity as a source of sound or audio. The sound component is positional and is thus affected by the components-position.

autoplay.description: Whether to automatically play sound once set.

distanceModel.description: Sound model: linear, inverse, or exponential.

loop.description: Whether to loop the sound once the sound finishes playing.

maxDistance.description: Maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.

on.description: An event for the entity to listen to before playing sound.

poolSize.description: Numbers of simultaneous instances of this sound that can be playing at the same time

positional.description: Whether or not the audio is positional (movable).

refDistance.description: Reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.

rolloffFactor.description: Describes how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener.

src.description: URL path to sound file e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/sound/wave.mp3'

volume.description: How loud to play the sound.

dynamic-body.title: Physics
dynamic-body.description: Physics type attached to the object.

impulse.title: Impulse
impulse.description: The force applied using physics. Requires click-listener

collision-listener.title: Collision Listener
collision-listener.description: Name of the collision-listener, default can be empty string

video_object.description: Name of object where to put the video, e.g. 'square_vid6'

frame_object.description: URL of a thumbnail image, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/images/conix-face-white.jpg'

video_path.description: URL of the video file, e.g. 'store/users/wiselab/videos/kungfu.mp4'

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Parent's object_id. Child objects inherit attributes of their parent, for example scale and translation.

buffer.title: Buffer
buffer.description: Transform geometry into a BufferGeometry to reduce memory usage at the cost of being harder to manipulate (geometries only: box, circle, cone, ...).

skipCache.title: Skip Cache
skipCache.description: Disable retrieving the shared geometry object from the cache. (geometries only: box, circle, cone, ...).

url.title: Url
url.description: Model URL. Store files paths under 'store/users/<username>' (e.g. store/users/wiselab/models/factory_robot_arm/scene.gltf); to use CDN, prefix with 'https://arena-cdn.conix.io/' (e.g. https://arena-cdn.conix.io/store/users/wiselab/models/factory_robot_arm/scene.gltf)

cast.title: cast shadow
cast.description: Whether the entity casts shadows onto the surrounding scene

receive.title: receive shadow
receive.description: Whether the entity receives shadows from the surrounding scene

value.title: Text Value
value.description: Any string of ASCII characters. e.g. 'Hello world!'

text.title: Text Value (deprecated; don't use)
text.description: Please use attribute 'value' in new Text objects;

color.title: color (deprecated; don't use)
color.description: Color is an attribute of the material; Add a material to change the color of the object

color.title: color (deprecated; don't use)
color.description: Color is an attribute of the material; Add a material to change the color of the object

color.title: color (deprecated; don't use)
color.description: Color is an attribute of the material; Add a material to change the color of the object

light.title: light (deprecated; don't use)
light.description: These attributes (light, intensity, color, ...) can be set directly on the light object (instead of this light attribute inside the light object); dont use in new light objects

type.title: type
type.description: One of ambient, directional, hemisphere, point, spot.

groundColor.title: ground color
groundColor.description: Light color from below. NOTE: Hemisphere light type only

decay.title: decay
decay.description: Amount the light dims along the distance of the light. NOTE: Point and Spot light type only.

distance.title: distance
distance.description: Distance where intensity becomes 0. If distance is 0, then the point light does not decay with distance. NOTE: Point and Spot light type only.

angle.title: angle
angle.description: Maximum extent of spot light from its direction (in degrees). NOTE: Spot light type only.

penumbra.title: penumbra
penumbra.description: Percent of the spotlight cone that is attenuated due to penumbra. NOTE: Spot light type only.

target.title: target
target.description: element the spot should point to. set to null to transform spotlight by orientation, pointing to it’s -Z axis. NOTE: Spot light type only.

type.title: type
type.description: One of ambient, directional, hemisphere, point, spot.

groundColor.title: ground color (hemisphere)
groundColor.description: Light color from below. NOTE: Hemisphere light type only

decay.title: decay (point and spot)
decay.description: Amount the light dims along the distance of the light. NOTE: Point and Spot light type only.

distance.title: distance (point and spot)
distance.description: Distance where intensity becomes 0. If distance is 0, then the point light does not decay with distance. NOTE: Point and Spot light type only.

angle.title: angle (spot)
angle.description: Maximum extent of spot light from its direction (in degrees). NOTE: Spot light type only.

penumbra.title: penumbra (spot)
penumbra.description: Percent of the spotlight cone that is attenuated due to penumbra. NOTE: Spot light type only.

target.title: target (spot)
target.description: Id of element the spot should point to. set to null to transform spotlight by orientation, pointing to it’s -Z axis. NOTE: Spot light type only.

color.title: color (deprecated; don't use)
color.description: Color is an attribute of the material; Add a material to change the color of the object

color.title: color (deprecated; don't use)
color.description: Color is an attribute of the material; Add a material to change the color of the object

oneOf.title: Entity (generic object)
oneOf.description: Entities are the base of all objects in the scene. Entities are containers into which components can be attached.

oneOf.title: Three.js Scene
oneOf.description: Load a Three.js Scene (no support for THREE.js legacy scenes; Using glTF is preferred)

oneOf.title: Image
oneOf.description: Display an image on a plane

oneOf.title: Thickline
oneOf.description: Draw a line that can have a custom width

oneOf.title: Cube (deprecated; don't use)
oneOf.description: Cube (=Box) Geometry; Supported for Legacy reasons; Please use Box in new scenes

object_id.description: A uuid or otherwise unique identifier for this object

action.description: One of 3 basic Create/Update/Delete actions or a special client event action (e.g. a click)

persist.description: Persist this object in the database (default false = do not persist)
